Title: KinecTunes
Description: KinecTunes allows you to control iTunes with your voice, using Microsoft Kinect and a Windows 7 PC.  It's developed in .NET 4.0 using C#, the Kinect SDK beta, and the iTunes COM library.  See how it works: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bRmxKZm-TVE
HomeWiki:
Project Description

KinecTunes allows you to control iTunes with your voice, using Microsoft Kinect and a Windows 7 PC. It's developed in .NET 4.0 using C#, the Kinect SDK beta, and the iTunes COM library. See how it works: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bRmxKZm-TVE

Requirements

Software:
  • Windows 7 (x86 or x64)
  • iTunes version 10.0 and up
  • Microsoft .NET Framework 4.0 Client Profile
  • Kinect SDK Beta
  • Various Microsoft Speech Libraries (x86 ONLY):
    • Microsoft Speech Platform - Server Runtime, version 10.2 (x86 edition)
    • Microsoft Speech Platform - SDK, version 10.2 (x86 edition)
    • Kinect for Windows Runtime Language Pack
Hardware:
  • Computer with a dual-core, 2.66-GHz or faster processor and 2 GB of RAM
  • Windows 7â€“compatible graphics card that supports Microsoft® DirectX® 9.0c capabilities
  • Kinect for Xbox 360® sensor - retail edition, which includes special USB/power cabling

Features
  • Control iTunes with your voice:
    • Play specific songs or artists
    • Pause or Stop iTunes
  • Two implementations of KinecTunes libraries: Command-line tool and Windows Form app
